posts.name: Wesley (wes)
posts.cooked:
Our team is experiencing unusually high failure rates for our radios.  Many (more than three) will power on but will not connect with wifi.  We’ve tried re-flashing them, and while successful, we’re still not able to establish wireless connections.

Any insight would be greatly appreciated.

posts.name: Wesley (wes)
posts.cooked:
I’d like to add that we did test every single one of our radios at the beginning of the season, and most of them worked.

It’s just baffled us to be quite honest

posts.name: Joe Ross
posts.cooked: What settings are you using when reflashing the radio?

posts.name: Wesley (wes)
posts.cooked:
FRC Radio Config Utility Settings:

Team Number: our team number WPA Key: None Robot Name: radio1/2/3/etc Radio: OpenMesh Mode: 2.4g ap BW Limit: false/true (we’ve tried both) Firewall: false

posts.name: David Ellers
posts.cooked: Can you connect to them when they are on a table vs. in the robot?

posts.name: Scott Kukshtel
posts.cooked: How are you powering the radio on the robot? You may already know this, but if you give the radio less than 1 Amp, the radio lights will come on but it will not connect. If you are still using the CTRE VRM, using the 12V / 500 mA connection will cause this condition.

posts.name: Wesley (wes)
posts.cooked: Sorry for the late response, but we have tried both on the bench and on the robot.  We are powering with both a bench supply and with the radio power module.

posts.name: Wesley (wes)
posts.cooked: We’re powering it using the radio power module, and on the bench we’re powering using a bench supply.

posts.name: Hassan Naqvi
posts.cooked: What Voltage and Amperage is your bench supply on? and is the RPM connected to a Rev PDH RPM connection or the CTRE VRM?

posts.name: Wesley (wes)
posts.cooked: The bench supply is at 12v 5a.  I’m not sure about the RPM connector on the robot

posts.name: system
posts.cooked: This topic was automatically closed 365 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
